Description: Black –topped cup with round base, made of Nile silt pottery with many organic inclusions. The exterior is coated with red slip, blackened at the rim, and loosely burnished. The interior is black slipped and burnished. The slip does not adhere well to the clay.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Marked 1206 on base. Identified as Black-top ware B1f in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery by Baumgartel in Petrie’s Naqada Excavations: A Supplement (London 1970), p. lxi, but the fabric is like Rough ware.
